thread.title: India: Terrorists gun down retired police officer during mosque prayer in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla - India News News

author: @wion
title: India: Terrorists gun down retired police officer during mosque prayer in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla - India News News
text: India: Terrorists gun down retired police officer during mosque prayer in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla Story highlights The retired police officer was offering prayers at a mosque in Baramulla when the incident took place. The retired police officer was offering prayers at a mosque in Baramulla when the incident took place. Terrorists fatally shot dead a retired police officer during prayer at a mosque in Baramulla, in India's Jammu and Kashmir. Mohammed Shafi Mir was a retired senior superintendent of police and was a resident of Gantamulla Bala village in Baramulla. Official X account of Kashmir Zone Police in a post wrote,"Terrorists fired upon Shri Mohd Shafi, a retired police officer at Gantmulla, Sheeri #Baramulla, while praying Azan in the mosque and succumbed to injuries. Area has been #cordoned off. Further details awaited." — Kashmir Zone Police (@KashmirPolice) [#Terrorists]fired upon Shri Mohd Shafi, a retired police officer at Gantmulla, Sheeri [#Baramulla], while praying Azan in the mosque and succumbed to injuries. Area has been [#cordoned]off. Further details awaited. [@JmuKmrPolice] [December 24, 2023] [×](https://www.wionews.com) The incident came to light one day following the successful prevention of an infiltration attempt by the Indian army in the Akhnoor sector of the Jammu region. Four terrorists had attempted to breach Indian territory near the International border in the Akhnoor area. The Indian army reported that the terrorists were observed dragging a body across to the opposite side of the fence. (Keep tracking for more developments)
